com:
Welcome to the official /mlp/ Secret Santa 2022 thread! Tell Santa all your wildest wishes and come join us in sending cards, gifts, and cheer to your fellow Pony lovers!
Sign-ups are closed and gift and card assignments are out.
HEY! CHECK IN TO THE THREAD. Make sure to check your emails and check into the thread so that your Santa knows that you’re alive and can ask you questions.

>How’s this thing work?
Read the FAQ!
The short form:
Gifts are given Round Robin Circle Jerk style (A gives to B gives to C who gives to A) while cards are exchanged traditionally (whomever you give a card to should send one back to you). You will be randomly assigned anons by email after the signups are over so please keep an eye out!

Latecomers are now OVER!

Nov the past: Gift assignments out. Card assignments out.
Dec 1st - 10th: The latest suggested mailing period. Consider mailing on the early side if you’re shipping internationally.

FAG here: https://fag.anonfilly.com/

Coordinator email for comments/concerns/general inquiries: MLPSecretSanta2022@gmail.com
Contact for questions about any card issues: thecardslut@gmail.com
Kiwi: Resident corpse, international correspondent, and expert in dealing with people who don't understand deadlines. kiwilatecomers@gmail.com

>WHERE’S MY SANTEE/SANTA?!
In your walls.
Hey you goofballs, you need to CHECK IN.

>BUT IT’S NOT EVEN THANKSMAS YET! REEEEE!
YES! IT! IS! IT'S ALREADY DECEMBER!
We are in the thick of it now. Get those gifts and cards out the door. Get those crafts finished.
And while you wait for the glue to dry or the parcels to arrive join us in thread and draw a cute OC, write a song, join a giveaway, chat about your holiday plans, and just spend some time with us here in the thread.

com:
Howdy, partner!

What you see here began as a series of comedy-centric stories with the concept of an alicorn-ascended Princess Applejack trying to change a mismanaged Equestria for the better by humorously interacting with the other, quite lazy, princesses. Plus late night pink antics.

Not to mention a whole bunch of Changelings with nothing better to do but cause mischief.


The whole thing was set in motion by this gem:

~~~~~

>So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

>Because you seem to be the only goddamn one of those ponies who gets that a Princess need to do actual work regarding maintenance of the kingdom. You know how much city planning or trade negotiations Twilight or Luna have done? Fucking nothing. Everyone is obsessed with the world ending threats they think I should fight, but the minute I point out the free health care I have to work to maintain everyone goes quiet. And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. Go do actual princess stuff, because apparently everyone else got the pamphlets mixed up or something and thinks "Princess" means "Beat cop."

~~~~~

Are you feeling creative? Try your hand at writing a story! No contribution is too small and we love having new folks around.

If you're more artistically inclined give a drawing or sketch a shot. Don't fret too much; it doesn't have to be fancy and we appreciate artwork a lot.

If that isn't your style either, writers always need feedback. So tell us what you liked - and what you didn't - to help us improve.

If you are unsure about anything, do not be afraid to ask. We will gladly bring you up-to-date or explain anything you feel is unclear.

Thread 355, and the holidays are live!

sub: /FoE/ - Fallout Equestria: A Post Apocalyptic Pony Thread
com:
Wasteland carols edition

Fallout Equestria, a story that bleeds two franchises together to build something magical. On one side, you have death, destruction, decay, and misery - on the other, you have ponies. Doesn't sound like it should mix? You'd be surprised. When the world around you is wasteland, all you're left with is hope, and as we all know, ponies can do spectacular things with just a little hope.
Previous thread: >>39186895

Read Fallout Equestria by Kkat to appreciate the setting that many writers have then lent upon after being so captivated by the wonders.
The original story which spawned its own fandom can be found here: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/119190/

These next four stories comprise the rest of what is considered "the big 5", alongside the original. They were biggest hitters early in the fandom, be it for having started before many others, their length, or overall quality.

Project Horizons:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/208056/

Pink Eyes:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/931/

Murky Number Seven:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/47300/

Heroes:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/662/

Though, a reminder; just because these are the most well known, that isn't to say that there aren't other stories out there! There are many hidden gems that simply don't get the love they deserve purely because people don't give them the chance. Why not open your heart and try to find a new favorite? Anons are absolutely welcomed and encouraged to return with fic discussion of even the most obscure fics!

>Fan games:
Fallout Equestria: Remains is a Fallout Equestria Roguelike. It is the best thing to come of the fandom recently. Seriously go play it https://foe-remains.gitlab.io/main_en.html

Balefire Blues is a Hearts of Iron IV mod. In it you take control over various FoE factions seeking to conquer the wasteland. steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2307988796

Ashes Town is a derivative of Pony Town in the Fallout Equestria universe.

last_replies.com:
>She was still, staring at the wall.
>But her eyes were unfocused. They glanced elsewhere, into her soul. Into her memories most sacred.
>She blinked. An aura of light swept over her, cleaning her disheveled fur, removing days' worth of grime.
>The old nag turned into a majestic Princess, within a single heartbeat.
>She turned her face and looked at you. Her smile was practiced but mechanical.
>"Anon. My oldest friend. You return."
>You nodded. Taking a moment to collect yourself.
"You weren't at the fune-"
>"I didn't know what to say. You can't recycle material for funerals, you know. That wouldn't be polite."
>Her mouth clicked shut, embarrassed.
>A moment passed. Then another.
>"How do you do it?", she said, as if to the open air.
>You reached up and touched your sideburns, with the grey just now creeping in.
"My mind is different, I suppose," you said, wondering why this never came up before. "We were made to last. A century to you is just a decade to us."
>She smile turned genuine. You didn't know why.
>"I've always wondered why you never killed yourself, you know. Why all others refused my gift of LIFE." The light of the sun echoed through that last word, almost blinding your ears. It scared you, just for a moment. It was beautiful. "Even when they were the ones to ask for it. To beg for it"
>You shrugged. "We were meant to last. Ponies weren't. Not for this long. Not as they are. I guess I'm finally starting to feel the weight of my mortality."
>She turned her body to you. She looked vulnerable. Raw. Happy.
>"Please tell me you're here for it. What I've always wanted."
>"Please don't leave me all alone."
>You nodded, and she hugged you.

This is the Pregnancy General, not stillborn and ready to be borne again. We've lately been building up a bundle of regular artists, storytellers, and others again; may this general get quicker and continue quickening.

For files and other things we can't discuss in this thread, there's a fraternal twin thread over inside Pregchan, the premiere pregnancy imageboard:
https://pregchan.com/f/res/100.html

That thread has extremely little in comparison to the prior Pregchan threads, which have been archived here:
https://web.archive.org/web/20211104233933/https://pregchan.com/f/res/100.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20220611172822/https://pregchan.com/f/res/14888.html

Because of that drama with Pastebin, here are two archives:
https://u.smutty.horse/lxqgizelhjx.zip
https://u.smutty.horse/lzbpjsjvhjs.zip

Here are some questions to stimulate activity while waiting for the birth:
How would you feed and otherwise care for your gravid dam?
Which aspects of magical pony pregnancy excite you most?
To be or not to be hyper pregnant?
Shoving bellies aside, which anatomical change do you most appreciate?
What's something rarely covered in art or stories you'd like to see focussed on?
Who are your favourite artists and writers; which pieces of theirs are your favourites?
For the relevant species, such as pegasi, do you prefer eggs or live birth?
Would you want to help your mare dress herself, and in what?
How would you cuddle your gravid mare and where?
Just how would you comfort your mare if she had a tummy ache, possibly from eating too much cake?

>You visit The School of Friendship and find Starlight Glimmer at a desk in the faculty lounge.
>"Welcome Anon! Have a seat. Phyllis and I were just finishing up grading some papers before heading back to my main office."
>You raise an eyebrow.
>"Oh, Phyllis is my plant right here...as well as the little one inside me. Since Sunburst wouldn't allow me to name our firstborn Phyllis, this one will definitely be named that. Especially since it's not his anyway. You don't mind that name for our foal do you?"
>You tell her you don't mind but question how she knows it will be a female.
>She smiles. "I'm glad you asked." She opens the desk drawer and pulls out an amulet that looks kind of like a clock.
>"I've been working on time magic for awhile and Time Turner offered to help with the mechanisms required to get it to work in the form of an amulet. I used it to take a peak and see if our foal will be a filly or not. Since you have given me another chance to have a foal with the name I always wanted, you can have this. last_replies.com:
>>39395529
>There is a whole team of people walking around, quick on their feet but silent to the best of their abilities. They are all business and no talk.
>Remembering Carol's article, you tell your companion to get down before you get noticed. Whoever these people are, they're definitely no police, you can tell that much. Actually, you don't see any police anywhere, just those operatives.
>Black suits, black cars with tinted windows, bright flashlights, a whole assortment of tools that they've taken here to account for anything that might've been scorched by magic. That includes the burnt up car and its pieces that are getting documented and taken away into a nondescript minivan.
>The only thing that stands out about it are the wheels and the windows. They seem a bit too new for this kind of regular workhorse, you bet they're bulletproof.
>"Who are these people?"
"No idea, some kind of clean up crew," you squint in an attempt to see if there's more of them in ambush somewhere. "Apparently they're always the first on the scene when something goes wrong with pony magic."
>"But nothing goes- Well, there was one time recently, but..."
"They've obviously been preparing for incidents like this. Maybe you're not as subtle as you think."
>That just makes the pony sigh.
>"Our own cleanup crew usually gets everything first. Where are they? I'll give Twilight a piece of my mind when we get back..."
"What are we going to do now?"
>It's obvious you'll get apprehended the moment your face shows up at the scene, with or without a pony trotting by your side.
>Something tells you that potential witnesses are valued by whoever is so professionally interested in pony activity in this world.
>"We'll do the usual, infiltrate from above."
"But how are you-"
>"Don't worry, it's standard procedure for our teams and they've never been caught."
"They didn't have federal agents snooping around in their way, what if they have traps or something?"
>"Oh, please, pony magic is so delicate you can't reverse engineer it in this world."
>You don't like the sound of that. Confidence can lead to the most obvious mistakes you could make.
>"And now I'm sounding like Twilight myself," the mare chuckles quietly. "Come on."
>She is looking at you expectantly.
"Come on what?"
>"Hold me."
>No hesitation on her part.
"Shouldn't we wait until they're gone?" you nod in your apartment's direction.
>"If they are still busy here they probably haven't checked the witnesses yet, or are already done with them. Either way, inside should be safe...if we enter without them knowing. Now hold onto me."
>You hesitantly touch the mare's suit. Even with this light of a touch you can feel how tender her little body is.
>"I need you to grab me so we can teleport together."
>The pony is patient with you. You get in closer and your hands encircle her barrel in the middle as if you're about to pick her up and carry at your side.

last_replies.name: A Wish Enough for Two
last_replies.com:
>>39395535
>You even get on your knees to at least be level with her but that makes this all the more embarrassing to you.
>"Come on, I won't bite. It's easier on the magic reserve that way."
>Tightening your embrace means putting your head right next to hers. Even through the protection shield you see her kind eyes watching you as your cheek touches the cold sealed material of the suit.
>"Aww, don't worry. It's just a teleport, hold tight and don't let go even after we're clear, okay?"
>You feel like her cheek is touching yours from under the suit and you hear her breath so close, it distracts you from your extreme awkwardness for a mere second.
>Just enough time for the world to quite literally disappear from under your legs.
>You almost scream in panic but in a blinding flash the cold hard surface once again appears under your legs. The scream that never was turned into a sheepish little yelp.
>The pony can't help it and giggles.
>You already start letting her go but for some reason you can't keep your balance and fall over.
>Thankfully, it's not a long fall.
>"The shock will wear off in a moment. Now, let me see..."
>As you recover from the spell you realize that you're no longer anywhere near your building, instead this feels more like...a roof?
>Your guess is proven right by the mare who waves her hoof at you from the precipice. She's looking down without even trying to conceal herself. You're a bit more careful about it, barely showing your head above the concrete.
>"Where's your window supposed to be?"
>You have to lean in a bit and it makes your head spin. The ground below is scaring you and you're not sure this pony can be trusted to keep you safe.
>Still, you concentrate on finding the right column of windows and after some time you think you can guess correctly.
>It's also an opportunity to look at the special agents working on the scorched street.
>They're picking up some small black parts off the ground all around the place where the fight was taking place.
>Burnt concrete and asphalt show the path of that nightmare alicorn's magic across it. The car is now a piece of burnt metal. No sign of Carol.
>Someone is arguing with one of the agents in the yellow circle of a street light and by the indoor clothes and frantic gesturing you can guess it's one of the residents. The words barely reach you but if it's the car's owner it's gonna be a long discussion.
>And those black things are all over the place. A bit too late you realize what they actually are.
>"Anon, over here!" your pony guide calls you with an exagerrated whisper.
>Those are the not so hidden living cameras used on you and discarded now after they've lived past their usefulness.
>The pony asks you the same thing when you approach her as she is looking down.
>"Are those...birds? Dead birds?"
"Yeah. It's a long story."
>"How gruesome," sadness in her voice makes you feel a bit sad too.
"How are you planning on getting inside?"

last_replies.name: A Wish Enough for Two
last_replies.com:
>>39395552
>"You are going to get on my back and I'm going to magically open the window for us to fly inside."
"You're- You know what, let's get to it. I don't like this."
>The pony watches where your finger is pointing now, below, where one of the agents is explaining something to others in a hurry. He's showing them something on his tablet.
>The men disperse and get to their cars, leaving only a few to watch the surroundings. The part you're uncomfortable with is them reaching to their suits as if each of them has a weapon in there.
>"You're right. Let me just..."
>She concentrates on something and then swiftly sways her head to the side.
>A loud noise in the distance coincides with the pony's horn firing up a spell. Sounds like breaking glass.
>Immediately the agents take off to a completely different building. You even see one of the hiding ones get out of his car with a small briefcase in his hands.
>"Just a distraction, come on!"
>No time to blush this time around. You mount the pony in one awkward motion. She is still too small for her back to even reach your crotch. You'll have to actually sit down on her spine.
>Before you manage to do that, the hidden zippers on her sides are opened with magic and two candy pink wings unfurl from there, tired of their confinement.
>"Get ready."

Flutterrape is a collection of stories about ponies trying and failing to have sex with Anon, the only human in Equestria. >Why alternate boorus?
Recent changes to Derpibooru have made the site a less than ideal location for pony fan art. So, several new boorus have arisen to provide alternatives. last_replies.name: PageantAnon
last_replies.com:
The poll will remain open for however long as anons would like to vote, but with 49 results so far here's where it is standing thus far on feedback

>What did you think of Randomized Seeding being used for Mr. /mlp/ 2022?
Almost 50% approval with the randomization of the brackets this year, with the remaining half mostly mixed and a little negative in reception. Leaning on an overall positive reception, but not strictly a majority with Seeding still being preferable to a number of voters. Next year in the poll I do roughly a month ahead of the pageant, I'll do another poll to see if people feel like doing Random or Seeding for Miss since it looks like the majority could still lean one way or the other.

>What did you think of the update to the round lengths this year with the 24 hour voting periods?
Overall positive, a little less than half remain mixed or disapproving of the day long cycles but it looks like a solid number of people prefer it to the 36 hours of voting. Again, next year I'll include a poll ahead of the actual event to see if we want to keep with 24 hours for next year but this may become a permanent change if it receives continued support.

>What did you think of the mini-brackets used in Mr. /mlp/ollo 2022?
Generally approving, which is good to hear as I know a number of people were looking forward to them. The first implementation here was a bit messy but I think I have ideas for how to improve and refine the process for both choosing categories as well as determining which nominees belong in which bracket going forward if we decide to try this out as well for Miss /mlp/ 2023

>Should there be a cap to how many are allowed to participate in a given sub-category?
Majority agrees 16 should be the limit for each mini-bracket, cutting down a bit from the 20-30ish average we had for most categories this year

>Should there be a one-per limit to how many sub-categories a nominee can compete in at once
Majority agrees that no nominee should be restrained to only a single sub-category and to let them compete in as many as they are nominated for.

>Should there a be a limit on the number of sub-categories?
Majority agrees on a limit of 8 sub-categories per tournament, cutting down from the 11 we had this year. Between 8 mini-brackets and 16 candidates each, that's about the same number of matches as the main tournament itself which seems appropriate.

>In the case of ties during the Rounds, what is your preferred method of resolving them?
No option had a majority and they all had varying levels of support, so when the pre-pageant poll comes around I'll narrow down the options to 2-3 of the most popular to see if we can get a majority. It's worth noting the 3-way idea used in /co/ & /v/ has the most support so far

com:
Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

sub: Pony's Quest X (yet another Inept CYOA)
com:
What, you didn't think Into the Blue was the only CYOA I was running, did you?


>who's this faggot again?
I'm a QM that used to have a lot more spare time. Then 2020 happened and my life went to Hell, so I decided to put this CYOA on hold for awhile. It's been that way for a LOT longer than I ever intended for it to. I'm sorry for that; I'm sure most of you who played this back in its heyday (~2019 or so) are long gone... But that's alright. That's how life goes sometimes. There's no sense crying about the past, so let's move on. I'm back, and I'd like to continue this CYOA, with whoever's left and whoever is yet to come. So, if you'd like to play, come on in!

>okay faggot so how does THIS game work?
Unlike Into the Blue, this game is a lot more story-focused. You play as a unicorn colt named Tough Cookie, a comic and action show fan who's getting the chance of a lifetime: to be a REAL superhero. It's up to you to guide him in his quest to protect his friends and family, his hometown, and his world.

Since anonpone.com seems to be broken right now, here's a more direct link to the previous threads:

name: QM
com:
>Space.... may be the final frontier, but it also sure as fuck is the most boring one
>It might have been something very special a millenia ago, back when the first pony left Equestria
>But as you drift through the endless void inside of your tin can you can't help but be bored beyond belief
>Out here you don't even get access to any of the station radios to take your mind off of the inky blackness
>And while you'd love to say that you could have just played some music you loaded onto your ship's board computer...
>The entire ship goes dark as if it knew what you were thinking about, the humming power core silencing itself
>You groan in annoyance and unbuckle yourself as you gently begin floating upwards in the lack of gravity
>Not that this piece of space junk has any gravity anyways, even with the reactor online
>Using one of your hooves to hold yourself to your captain's chair you align yourself carefully to the door at the back
>A gentle push propels you forward, carrying your lithe form through the cabin before seconds later you touch opposite end
>Taking holf of one of the many pipes moving along the wall you pull yourself to the airlock carefully and press the button next to it
>Frowning, you glare at the stubborn door and the fact that the emergency power decided to crap out on you as well
>In frustration you decide it is a great idea to kick the door, just to realize that every action has an equal reaction and in space there is nothing to stop you
>Going for a backwards tumble you flail your helpless hooves and even try flapping your wings to no avail
>No air and no gravity means your feathery (albeit covered by your flight suit) appendages are basically useless anyways
>Slamming head first into the console you attempt to rub your snout before remembering that, yeah, you have a helmet on and for good reason
>Sadly, while slamming onto your controls usually seems to work wonders, your little crash has done nothing but... broken off a small switch that now floats between your eyes
"Great, absolutely fucking amazing", you shout as you slam down a hoof on the console, immediately regretting it
>This time you were wise to hold yourself against one of the bars mounted to the console so you don't get thrown away, but now your hoof is hurting like a bitch
>Cursing, you turn back around and push yourself off again, much less graceful this time as your irritation gets the better of you
>Holding on to the wheel that serves as an override to the airlock's door, you begin to turn it with all the might that your quite frankly not exactly trained muscles can muster
>In absolute silence you struggle but eventually the probably rusted wheel begins to turn and the door slowly slides open
>Squeezing through the small gap you've managed to create you struggle a bit as your hindquarters decide to hinder your progress for just a few seconds

>"It didn't have to come to this." Aunt Celestia said.
>"This is for your own good," was the last thing you heard Aunt Luna say.
>Aunt Celestia's face- full of disappointment, disgust, and pity... that's something you'll never forget.
>For weeks, you kept it together following your secret stint in rehab.
>Nopony told you that every time you denied your cravings, they'd just come back stronger, always when you least expected it.
>Everything was going along fine, until you went out into Canterlot proper for a little shopping; a treat to yourself for being so good.
>It was great at first.
>Ponies gave you a respectful berth and you even found the PERFECT dress to wear for the upcoming Winter Solstice Gala!
>But then, as you trotted back to the castle, bags in tow, the faintest scent graced your hypersensitive snout.
>Marinara sauce.
>Cheese.
>Pepperoni.
>Minced garlic.
>Sun-dried tomatoes.
>Judging by the intensity and the wind, you reckoned the source of the tempting scent to be Love Bug's Pizzeria- a five minute walk or thirty seconds by air.
>The trick to teleportation is focusing on where you want to go.
>Most unicorns that are capable of the feat oftentimes do it the first time by accident, spurned on by some stressor.
>As a Celestia-trained alicorn, you could teleport without thinking... which you did, unfortunately.
>The Royal Guard was summoned, naturally.
>Not that they had a hope of intervening, of course.
>Upon realizing how utterly outmatched they were, they opted to cordon off the area until your Aunts arrived.
>Aunt Luna gave you a teary hug before whispering, "I'm sorry," into your ear.
>That was three days ago.
>You shiver, but not from the cold.
>The sweats will start again soon.
"Auntie, please!" you try to shout.
>Sound travels differently up here, always sounding muffled, like it won't travel much past a wing's reach.
"Pizza!"
>This is truly what it means, to shout into the void.
>With one final effort, you drop to your haunches, throw your forehooves up, and scream towards your home, so very very far below.
"PEEEEEEETZZZZZZERRRRRRRR!!!!"
>But on the Moon, nopony can hear you scream.

Feels good to write again, even if it's on my phone whilst on the shitter at work.

sub: You get to go to Equestria
com:
but you have to choose from one of a number of preset ways in which you will arrive in Equestria.

>summoned by Sunburst
Sunburst went messing with things he shouldn't have and accidentally summoned a thrall. You are magically bound to be his loyal servant for a month. After that you will be completely free, even free to return to Earth. Sunburst may or may not do gay stuff to you while you can't say no.

>found by Trixie
You pop into existence somewhere in Equestria, only for the Great and Powerful Trixie to stumble upon your unconscious body shortly thereafter. She will drag you into her wagon, which is where you will eventually awake, so that she can care for you until she sees you're healthy. This occurs at some point shortly after Magic Duel.

>surrogate mother
At the moment of your conception your zygote was transferred to Celestia's womb. She then carried you to term and gave birth to you. Your memories from this life will subtly affect the character of your person as you grow as Celestia's child, but they will do so in a completely nebulous and unknown and unknowable way.

>alone in the Everfree
You wake up in the Everfree, alone. You have no clue where you are in relation to anything else nor do you know any helpful landmarks or the layout of the forest. There may be lethal dangers lurking behind every tree. It is up to you to escape with your life. Nothing is guaranteed.

>magical experiment
Some high level mages were testing a certain line of spells and ended up bringing you to Equestria. You were quickly put into a special quarantine and kept under watch by guards. They treat you as having a much more significant position in humanity than you really have. You are an impromptu diplomat and have to professionally handle a first contact situation.

>lunar link
One decade from now you work on a lunar base. During a solo excursion you are ripped from the Moon and down to Equestria. The stars aligned and during Nightmare Moon's escape she dragged you with her. You appear on the outskirts of Ponyville in an EVA suit and on a lunar buggy.

>What is this general?
NEET/Misfit Pone is a thread for ponies who despite their best efforts (or in some cases complete lack thereof) struggle to fit in with the rest of society.

>What sort of stories can you expect to find here?
• Slice of life stuff.
• Lots of odd cute ponies becoming the waifu stories.
• Lots of being the cute oddball pony stories.
• A few NEET-recovery stories.
• A lot of smut, if you're into that.
• Lots of ponies to get you started with a variety of personalities and quirks. Don't like one of them? Give another NEET a try!
• Much, much more!

>Quick rundown on the pre-existing ponies ITT:
Floor Bored - The OG OC NEET from the very first threads. Floor comes in all different forms, but she's typically portrayed as a horny and kinda dirty mare most of the time. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2321489)
Pardise Skies - Paradise is a pony who started off as a NEET but ends up going to univeristy in a PiE setting. She's very quiet, easily spooked, likes to wear clothes and speaks with a stutter. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2289220)
Moon Dancer - Huge bookworm.
Taku - Friend of Floor who is *very* into anime. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1722376)
Goldie Mops - Goldie is another friend of Floors, only she's into kaiju and big monsters. Speaks with a cute lisp and seems very adorkable. (https://ponerpics.org/images/6192935)
Chimney Peep - Floor's sports nerd friend (Pic above, pony with the hat and lazy eye)
Home Sick - Probably the least covered NEET. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1727410)
Wallflower Blush, of Equestria girls fame but as a pone. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1658572)
Cuppa Noodle - Cuppa is a NEET snekpony who likes cup noodles and very tight hugs. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1892447)
Cipher the Programmer - The super paranoid overthinking male NEET-pony (https://derpibooru.org/images/2236987)
Dot Matrix - A pony who is into retro gaming. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2577975)
Anon Mare - Anon Mare is entirely up to your own interpretation. Same premise as Anon Filly but all grown up. The self-insert pony.
Writer's Block - A NEET pony whos background is currently unclear. Know anything about her? Let us know ITT (https://derpibooru.org/images/2561414)
Starry Sails - A chubby mare who lives in a PiE kind of setting. Friends with Anon. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2657594)
